Long-term scheduling¶

Here we present the long-term scheduling module. The long-term scheduling module of spock has been concived to optimizing the planifification of targets on the SPECULOOS telescopes (SSO, SNO, Saint-Ex, TS, TN) and follow the strategy decided by the consortium.

Using input file¶

The first option to generate the plans is to use an input file with all information requiered. This file you be filled like the following example:

date_range: - “2021-01-01 15:00:00” - “2021-02-01 15:00:00” observatories: 1: name: SSO telescopes: [Io,Callisto,Ganymede,Europa] 2: name: SNO telescopes: [Artemis] 3: name: Saint-Ex telescopes: [Saint-Ex] 4: name: TS_La_Silla telescopes: [TS_La_Silla] 5: name: TN_Oukaimeden telescopes: [TN_Oukaimeden] strategy: “continuous” duration_segments: 20 nb_segments: 3 target_list: ./target_lists/speculoos_target_list_v6.txt

Then you only have to run the following lines of code:

[2]:

import SPOCK.long_term_scheduler as SPOCKLT
from astropy.time import Time

schedule = SPOCKLT.Schedules()
obs = 1
schedule.load_parameters('./input.csv',obs)
schedule.make_schedule(Altitude_constraint = 28, Moon_constraint = 30)
